definition: Something that helps or is useful; to be helped by or to help.
examples: Regular reading has many benefits. (noun)
Students benefit from extra practice. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Benefit = be-ne-fit—be in a good fit for you.

definition: To finish something; having all the parts, whole.
examples: Please complete the worksheet. (verb)
We have a complete set of books. (adjective)

definition: To grow or cause to grow; to create or improve over time.
examples: Caterpillars develop into butterflies.
They are developing a new app.

definition: A feeling of worry or sadness; to cause worry or sadness.
examples: To our dismay, the match was cancelled. (noun)
The news dismayed the crowd. (verb)

definition: Lack of difficulty; to make or become less difficult or painful.
examples: She spoke with ease. (noun)
Stretching can ease sore muscles. (verb)

definition: Small balls of frozen rain; to call out to or praise highly; to call a taxi.
examples: Hail covered the playground. (noun)
They hailed a cab after the show. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Hail can fall from clouds—or hail someone from across the road.

definition: A shortage or absence of something; to be without something needed.
examples: There is a lack of chairs in the hall. (noun)
Plants will die if they lack water. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Lack = a gap where something should be.

definition: A person highly skilled or in control; to learn something very well; main or most important.
examples: She is a master of chess. (noun)
He mastered the new routine quickly. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Master = master it so it’s no longer hard.

definition: A person who loves and supports their country.
examples: Patriots celebrate national holidays with pride.
A true patriot works to improve their country.

extra.memory_tip: Patriot = puts their country at heart.

definition: A planned piece of work; to throw forward, to show an image, or to estimate for the future.
examples: Our science project is about magnets. (noun)
They projected the film on a big screen. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Project = a planned job—or to ‘throw’ out light or ideas.

definition: To say something is good and should be chosen; to advise.
examples: Can you recommend a good book?
Doctors recommend rest after surgery.

definition: A comment or statement; to say something as a comment.
examples: Her remark made everyone laugh. (noun)
He remarked that the sky looked stormy. (verb)

definition: To stand for or act on behalf of; to show or describe in a particular way.
examples: Elected councillors represent the town.
The map represents mountains with triangles.

extra.memory_tip: Represent = present again, on behalf of something.

definition: As much as is needed; enough.
examples: We had sufficient food for everyone.
Please bring a sufficient number of pencils.

extra.memory_tip: Sufficient = ‘suf’ (up to) + ‘fic’ (make) → it makes up enough.

definition: Complete or absolute; to speak or say something.
examples: It was utter silence in the hall. (adjective)
She uttered a quick ‘thanks’. (verb)
